newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil sells 6.107 bln reais in Treasury papers.
newsitem.headline: Brazil sells 6.107 bln reais in Treasury papers.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank, on behalf of the National Treasury, raised 6.107 billion reais in an auction of notes and letters, dealers said.

A total of 2.426 billion reais of 184-day of National Treasury Letters known as LTNs, due in November 1 1997, was sold at an overnight call money rate of 2.47 percent a month. The Central Bank did not accept offers for 1.5 billion reais of 365-day LTNs.
A total of 1.234 billion reais was sold in two series of dollar-indexed National Treasury notes (NTN-D).

The bank sold 815 million reais of NTN-D notes, which are due on May 1 1999, and pay an annual yield of 11.60 percent. The bank also sold 485 million reais of NTN-D notes coming due May 1, 2000, paying an annual yield of 11.70 percent.

Some 2.447 billion reais were sold in National Treasury notes (NTN-H) indexed to the variation of Brazil's reference rate (TR). The notes, which are due in November 1, 1997, pay annual yields of 12.68 percent plus the variation of the TR in the maturity period.
